snippet: The School Renewal Program is Mayor Bill de Blasio’s attempt to improve troubled schools instead of shutting them down, but how they were supposed to improve has been difficult to discern.
abstract: New York City's Education Dept releases list of goals tied to Mayor Bill de Blasio's $400 million School Renewal Program amid criticism that program does not require enough improvement from struggling schools; de Blasio program abandons Mayor Michael Bloomberg's policy of shuttering low-performing schools in favor of rehabilitating them.
lead_paragraph: The School Renewal Program is Mayor Bill de Blasio’s attempt to improve troubled schools instead of shutting them down, but how they were supposed to improve has been difficult to discern.

headline.main: New York Education Dept. Clarifies Goals for Poor-Performing Schools
headline.print_headline: City Clarifies List of Goals for Schools Near Bottom
